animals.title: Fox
animals.subtitle: other name : arctic fox
animals.content: Characteristic : Arctic foxes must endure a temperature difference of up to 90–100 °C (160–180 °F) between the external environment and their internal core temperature.

animals.title: Dolphin
animals.subtitle: other name : see Dolphin
animals.content: Characteristic : A dolphin is an aquatic mammal within the infraorder Cetacea. Dolphin species belong to the families Delphinidae.

animals.title: Owl
animals.subtitle: other name : see Owl
animals.content: Characteristic : Owls are birds from the order Strigiformes, which includes over 200 species of mostly solitary and nocturnal birds of prey typified by an upright stance.

animals.title: Cat
animals.subtitle: other name : see Cat
animals.content: The cat (Felis catus) is a domestic species of small carnivorous mammal. It is the only domesticated species in the family Felidae and is commonly referred to as the domestic cat or house cat to distinguish it from the wild members of the family.

animals.title: Tiger
animals.subtitle: other name : see Tiger and Tigress
animals.content: Characteristic : Characteristic : The tiger is the largest living cat species and a member of the genus Panthera. It is most recognisable for its dark vertical stripes on orange fur with a white underside. An apex predator.

animals.title: Penguin
animals.subtitle: other name : see Penguin
animals.content: Characteristic : Penguins (order Sphenisciformes, family Spheniscidae are a group of aquatic flightless birds.

animals.title: Squirrel
animals.subtitle: other name : see Squirrel
animals.content: Characteristic : Squirrels are members of the family Sciuridae, a family that includes small or medium-size rodents..

videoText.title: Lions
videoText.content1: White Lion was an American glam metal band that was formed in
videoText.content2: New York City in 1983 by Danish vocalist and guitarist Mike
videoText.content3: Tramp and American guitarist Vito Bratta.

videoText.content1: Whales are a widely distributed and diverse group of fully

videoText.title: Penguins
videoText.content1: Penguins order Sphenisciformes, family Spheniscidae are
videoText.content2: a group of aquatic flightless birds.
videoText.content3: Highly adapted for life in the water
